entry.title: DevNTell - Hashleap
entry.summary:
ðŸŒˆ GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, Nasir Jamal (nas) gave us a look at his project, Hashleap: a web3 payments and financial management platform ðŸŒŸ Developer Spotlight Nasir is a software engineer with more than a decade and a half of experience in startups where he held IC and leadership positions. Before HashLeap he cofounded another startup called Rodeo to provide analytics to gig workers for which we raised close to a million dollars led by Seedcamp. He architected and built the first MVP along with the initial engineering team he hired. The company is still going on and his cofounders have gone on to raise another round. Before Rodeo, he was Director of Engineering at Wise and was also one of the first engineers at Deliveroo and helped grow the product team from under 10 to ~400. Throughout his career, he has been involved with early-stage companies with a focus on iterating and delivering products that solve customer problems. ðŸ”¥ About Hashleap From the About section of the Hashleap blog: Hashleap is on a mission to simplify crypto payments for small businesses, web3 companies or freelancers, DAOs and charities by making it part of their business process rather than a disconnected activity. entry.title: Maximizing Your AI Experience: How to Prompt Effectively in Midjourney
entry.summary:
If you are starting writing prompts for Midjourney and want to learn how to structure them, Additive Prompting is a simple way to do it. Editorial style photo of 1970 Dodge Charger, low angle camera shot, flames in the background, dramatic light
Midjourney is just one of many AI image generators that have sprung up recently. But unlike its competitors, Midjourney has a more dream-like and artsy style. It's not just about churning out photos - it's more like a painting tool that can help you create something truly unique. If you're into science-fiction or gothic artwork, then Midjourney is perfect. Additive Prompting One of the best ways to use Midjourney is with a technique known as additive prompting. Its a simple way of writing a structured prompt, and it involves creating specific sectâ€¦

entry.title: How to Build an NFT Gallery Using QuickNode's GraphQL NFT API
entry.summary:
In this tutorial, you will build an NFT gallery using QuickNode's GraphQL NFT API, Icy.tools, React, JavaScript, Next.js, Vercel, and TailwindCSS. The React web app will provide a user interface displaying a grid view of all the NFTs held by any Ethereum Name Service (ENS). You will fetch NFT data with icy-nft-tools.
What is QuickNode? QuickNode is a blockchain platform that provides infrastructure for developers to build and scale decentralized applications (DApps). It offers a suite of tools and services, including a developer API, to make it easier for developers to build, test, and deploy DApps on multiple blockchain networks. QuickNode aims to simplify the building process on blockchain and make it more accessible for developers while providing high-performance infrastructure to suppâ€¦

entry.title: DevNTell - Blocktorch (beta)
entry.summary:
ðŸŒˆ GM In this week's episode of DevNTell, DAO member Gery Pollak gives us an updated look at Blocktorch: an observability platform that helps builders understand the behavior of a decentralized application holistically. ðŸŒŸ Developer Spotlight Gery has 6 years of experience working in business development at FAANG and investing in startups in central & eastern Europe as a VC. He is a self-taught developer (CS50) who made his first steps in solidity development end of 2020 going through the likes of CryptoZombies, Ethernaut, DappUnivserity etc. Beginning of 2022 (at the time when he joined D_D ðŸ™‚ ) he started to work on Blocktorch together with his co-founder Amine who is a seasoned software engineer. ðŸ”¥ About Blocktorch From the About page of Blocktorch: The number of decentralized applications, their developers as well as users are growing at rapid speed, yet the tooling around web3 is not evolving fast enough. The underlying decentralized architecture is getting more complex and less understandable. To ensure web3 is mass market ready reliability is key. The talented engineering teams pushing the frontiers of innovation need the best tools to build the best products. We at Blocktorch are re-imagining how developers build and maintain their decentralized applications. We believe in empowering every software engineering team to gain a deeper understanding of their smart contracts as well as other decentralized components such that they can troubleshoot and resolve anomalies in minutes, not hours. Website: blocktorch.xyz Twitter: twitter.com/blocktorch Gery's Twitter: twitter.com/GeryPollak Gery's Discord handle: CapG(blocktorch.xyz)#9916 ðŸŽ¥ Presentation
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=stpQ3_Atfnw

entry.title: Building a Tokengated Community for Live Concerts with QuickNode: A Step-by-Step Tutorial
entry.summary:
In this comprehensive tutorial, we'll walk through the process of building a token-gated community for live concerts using QuickNode. We will create a custom token on the Ethereum network, develop a smart contract for the community, and design a frontend interface using QuickNode's API. This platform will allow concert organizers to offer exclusive live concert access to token holders. Prerequisites Basic understanding of Ethereum, Solidity, and smart contracts Familiarity with JavaScript and web development Node.js and npm installed on your local machine MetaMask or another Ethereum-compatible wallet
Step 1: Setting up the project As our first step, we will create a smart contract in Solidity for the token we later use for the gating. 1.1 Installing dependencies To begin, make sure you hâ€¦

entry.title: How to Migrate a DApp from Goerli to Sepolia Using QuickNode
entry.summary:
In this tutorial, you will learn how to migrate your DApp from Goerli to Sepolia using QuickNode, a fast and reliable RPC node provider. As you may know, the Goerli network has faced several issues recently, from the low availability of test funds to network downtime. Considering this, it makes perfect sense to take your testing from Goerli to Sepolia. 1. Updating the RPC node The first step for migrating your DApp is to get the RPC node of the new test network. For our example, we will use the Sepolia test network and QuickNode as the node provider. Go to their RPC Endpoints Service section by clicking on this link and click on the "Create an endpoint" button.
Select the chain. In our case, we will be selecting Ethereum.
Select the network, and click "continue".
Click on the "Create eâ€¦

entry.title: Decoding Decentralization
entry.summary:
In Part I of Decoding Decentralization, we framed Ethereum (and all blockchains really) as a distributed decentralized database. We then used the change-data capture design pattern to replay all transfer events of a given smart contract. By capturing those events through the log entries they create, we could aggregate them and determine how many Murakami Flower NFTs a given wallet address has, or which holder wallets constitute a whale, etc. In Part II, I want to dive deeper into the interaction between blocks, transactions, and the log entries they create, as well as the process of log ABI translation which is critical for any chain-based analytics.
The State of the Chain Address If we think of Ethereum as a gigantic database that manages the state, just like all traditional databases, tâ€¦

entry.title: Mastering Midjourney: CameraÂ Angles
entry.summary:
As you navigate the world of synthography, as the new format of creating images with artificial intelligence tools has been named, with virtual storytelling tools like Midjourney, DALL.E, and Adobes Firefly, one crucial aspect to consider is how you prompt camera angles. Camera angles are a crucial tool in filmmaking, photography, and synthography, that can make or break a scene, setting the tone and creating the desired mood for the audience.
In this blog post, well cover the best practices of prompting four standard camera angles in Midjourney: The eye-level angle The low angle The high angle The Dutch angle Eye-Level Angle
Prompt: Man is making a walk in a forest near a bright colored sky, in the style of graphic design-inspired illustrations, 32k UHD, colorful cartoon, smokey backgroâ€¦

entry.title: DevNTell - TalentLayer
entry.summary:
In this week's episode of DevNTell we were joined by Co-Founders Kirsten and Romain who gave us an overview of TalentLayer. ðŸŒŸ Developer Spotlight Kirsten is a co-founder and Executive Lead of TalentLayer. She's a college dropout, self-taught dev, and freelancer who's now leading the open-source movement behind TalentLayer. She spent the past 4 years consulting on various enterprise blockchain projects and an NFT marketplace SDK startup. Romain is the co-founder and the Technical Lead of TalentLayer. He led the team behind Europe's biggest sports data infra company for 6 years. He has spent the past 4 years experimenting and building teams and blockchain projects. ðŸ”¥ About TalentLayer From the TalentLayer Docs: TalentLayer is infrastructure for open service markets; backend tooling for building interoperable marketplaces that leverage an on-chain liquidity pool of users and services. TalentLayer provides core tooling for building marketplaces including: On-chain jobs and proposals Soul-bound identity and reviews Configurable escrow capable of supporting milestone, lump sum, hourly pay and more Decentralized and platform-managed dispute resolution options Configurable fees system enabling fees on escrow transactions, job posts, proposal submissions, dispute resolution Resources Website: https://www.talentlayer.org/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/talentlayer GitHub: https://github.com/TalentLayer LinkTree: https://linktr.ee/talentlayer Kirsten's Twitter: https://twitter.com/kirstenrpomales Romain's Twitter: https://twitter.com/Romain__TL ðŸŽ¥ Presentation

entry.title: DevNTell - 0xCord
entry.summary:
In this week's episode of DevNTell we were joined by Gilad who gave us an overview of 0xCord. In this presentation, Gilad demos how to use 0xCord with Chainlink VRF V2 both on-chain and off-chain. ðŸŒŸ Developer Spotlight Gilad studied computer science at Columbia and has been writing solidity code for the past 5 years. Hes currently working on 0xCord, a web3 infra hub for developers. ðŸ”¥ About 0xCord 0xCord.com is a web3 infra hub for developers. It's the easiest way to access web3 infrastructure via native payments, composability, and configuration, all in one unified place. With 0xCord's off-chain API, you can easily consume the Chainlink VRF V2 through a simple RESTful JSON API call, bridging the gap between web2 and decentralized web3 infrastructure. [Source] Resources Website: https://0xcord.com/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/0xCord Gilad's Twitter: https://twitter.com/freeslugs Hello World tutorial: https://mirror.xyz/0x055ebddE8fC573C24bB986deaE0EF1E2328f60E7/z2d4xbhoAl_-k2_yJGLErOAGt-C48qezq1AmAgtczq0 ðŸŽ¥ Presentation
